intro.text: In the end it turned out it's easier to destroy the planet than to destroy capitalism....In 2088 , all billionaires fucked off to space , leaving all of us normal folks to fend for ourselves against the Earth's vengeance , most of which they caused mind you , we were slowly dying civilization on a slowly dying planet.

You'd think that would make us unite , forget our differences but no , some people still wanted to feel superior to others , somehow forgetting that they've all been used by the same people nonetheless. There's a lot of factions now fighting over what little land is still habitable. Soon enough there'll be nothing left to fight for.

You're a scavenger looking through old tech-waste that was buried near your home , you find this shiny disk , it looks important , like it's designed to resist being destroyed , it also glows in the dark which is super cool.

Elder Blake.text:
Elder Blake:
Hello there, elder Blake at your service. What can I help you with?

choices.text: What can you tell me about this disk?

Elder Blake.text:
Elder Blake:
Well to be honest, I'm not really a science guy, I'm more into old arts, more specifically the old art of movies, a screen where people do all sorts of silly acts, you'd better go talk to Carlos, he would know more about this than me.

Elder Martin.text:
Elder Martin:
Hello there , What can elder Martin do in this fine day?

choices.text: What can you tell me about this disk?

Elder Martin.text:
Elder Martin:
This looks like one of those old devices that were used to store media a long time ago, that's basically all I know about it. You should talk to Carlos, he would know what to do even if he doesn't seem confident in his abilities.

Scientist Carlos.text:
Carlos:
Hello there, What did you find in that pile of garbage? batteries? capacitors? I could always use a good capacitor.
